commit.message:
Set the default pixel format to yuv420p (#237)

Only when using the default codec and the pixel format is not set.
This makes the videos more web friendly by default.

Closes #152.

commit.message:
Use dmabuf feedback instead of wl-drm to get compositor device (#235)

wl-drm is a private protocol and while all compositors support it now,
it may be removed in future.

This adds dependency on libdrm to be able to get the device path from
dev_t returned from dmabuf feedback main_device.

verification.payload:
tree 89ac6ce05f1f26f9ac4c1b2d6d2af3a1e76ef58d
parent 22f18cdf481bb98bced3fc40baa52f877ea4272f
author David Rosca <nowrep@gmail.com> 1700316278 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1700316278 +0100

Use dmabuf feedback instead of wl-drm to get compositor device (#235)

dev_t returned from dmabuf feedback main_device.

any git metadata.

commit.message:
Break early when exit_main_loop is set in encoder thread (#223)

* Revert "Only flush when video codec has delay (#209)"

This reverts commit ffcb6f94f941fd820885d98c295ed303b83b0eb1.

* Break early when exit_main_loop is set in encoder thread

Prevent sending old buffer to encoder.
This is actually the correct fix for the issue described
in previous (reverted) commit.

tree 7d235d175f05077357fc7112e015fb852e009c8c
parent 8792d4f6a34c2ed8659ff523104c72e0f0c3205e

Break early when exit_main_loop is set in encoder thread (#223)

* Revert "Only flush when video codec has delay (#209)"

This reverts commit ffcb6f94f941fd820885d98c295ed303b83b0eb1.

* Break early when exit_main_loop is set in encoder thread

Prevent sending old buffer to encoder.
This is actually the correct fix for the issue described
in previous (reverted) commit.

commit.message:
Add support for 16 bit deep formats (#184)

As FFmpeg does not currently have alpha-less variants of RGBA64,
BGRA64, or RGBAF16, we use the alpha variants instead. This is not
a significant problem in practice, because a) source buffers often
have the X channel filled with ones b) encoding video generally
drops the alpha channel c) worst case, the user can strip alpha with
filters. If alpha-less formats ever become available, wf-recorder can
switch to them.

verification.payload:
tree dee338461597396a27bbabe5d54ad424175bdd90
parent ef969acf6db67a59216c494129efabc986d165a4
author mstoeckl <code@mstoeckl.com> 1691585206 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1691585206 +0200

Add support for 16 bit deep formats (#184)

As FFmpeg does not currently have alpha-less variants of RGBA64,
BGRA64, or RGBAF16, we use the alpha variants instead. This is not
a significant problem in practice, because a) source buffers often
have the X channel filled with ones b) encoding video generally
drops the alpha channel c) worst case, the user can strip alpha with
filters. If alpha-less formats ever become available, wf-recorder can
switch to them.

commit.message:
Revert "Use VP9+Opus on MKV for recordings"

This reverts commit 163b5d328d53fab664fc8d9f00e40abe85eb81d1.

Revert "Use VP8+Vorbis on WebM for recordings (#202)"

This reverts commit a40f9ad9f09fa142092c67e19f8679246b7ad8af.

Use codec format which best matches input (#215)

Use the most closely matching codec pixel format when the input
format is not available. For example, with input bgr0, this will
automatically prefer yuv444p over yuv420p when the codec supports
it, leading to more accurate recording of colored text and other
features with pixel-scale color variation.

verification.payload:
tree 35d8d4fe8d0443c7a6b7d97a62cbc3a8d0a7de18
parent 4c62832edc22ca7d0e65a514536b26432cce76cd
author mstoeckl <code@mstoeckl.com> 1691573588 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1691573588 +0200

Use codec format which best matches input (#215)

Use the most closely matching codec pixel format when the input
format is not available. For example, with input bgr0, this will
automatically prefer yuv444p over yuv420p when the codec supports
it, leading to more accurate recording of colored text and other
features with pixel-scale color variation.

commit.message: Retry capture on failure

Use gbm_bo_create_with_modifiers when possible

gbm_bo_create will return DRM_FORMAT_MOD_INVALID and that may
not be importable on compositor side with some formats.
Fallback to gbm_bo_create for GPUs without modifiers support.

Reduce memory usage with DMA-BUF capture (#219)

Don't allocate extra buffer when mapping DRM frame.
Also keep the initial pool size default.

verification.payload:
tree 0c1c915d0df7b5026705c9d7dd89f9a852cf7610
parent 3a2416fd4f1f5752aa12a02e5ab6ffbba82d1a1c
author David Rosca <nowrep@gmail.com> 1691571835 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1691571835 +0200

Reduce memory usage with DMA-BUF capture (#219)

Don't allocate extra buffer when mapping DRM frame.
Also keep the initial pool size default.

commit.message:
Gracefully terminate on SIGTERM/SIGHUP to avoid corruption (#183)

If wf-recorder doesn't terminate gracefully, including closing the ffmpeg
stream, the generated recording is possibly corrupted, and can't be readily
played (with problems such as the infamous "moov atom not found" ffmpeg error)

wf-recorder _does_ gracefully terminate on a SIGINT signal, which is usually
generated by pressing Ctrl+C on the terminal. However, when wf-recorder was
terminated with a SIGTERM/SIGHUP, the default signal action was applied, which
terminated it without proper cleanup, possibly creating a corrupted recording.

Since SIGTERM/SIGHUP generally imply the program should gracefully terminate
(and SIGTERM is the typical way to kill a backgrounded process), handle them
like SIGINT, by closing the recording and exiting the main loop.

verification.payload:
tree 17e5cba5e8154d4f28644738235d4285785830ab
parent bb3ed360a4df95e586a4f7a2c95cf7b1ac3ab6fb
author Joan Bruguera <joanbrugueram@gmail.com> 1672651122 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1672651122 +0100

Gracefully terminate on SIGTERM/SIGHUP to avoid corruption (#183)

If wf-recorder doesn't terminate gracefully, including closing the ffmpeg
stream, the generated recording is possibly corrupted, and can't be readily
played (with problems such as the infamous "moov atom not found" ffmpeg error)

wf-recorder _does_ gracefully terminate on a SIGINT signal, which is usually
generated by pressing Ctrl+C on the terminal. However, when wf-recorder was
terminated with a SIGTERM/SIGHUP, the default signal action was applied, which
terminated it without proper cleanup, possibly creating a corrupted recording.

Since SIGTERM/SIGHUP generally imply the program should gracefully terminate
(and SIGTERM is the typical way to kill a backgrounded process), handle them
like SIGINT, by closing the recording and exiting the main loop.
